title: Waste Image Classification
description: A deep learning model built with PyTorch to classify waste into four categories—compost, recycle, paper, and trash. Trained on a combined dataset using custom DataLoaders, extensive preprocessing, and hyperparameter tuning. Includes evaluation through confusion matrices, classification reports, and a Flask API for real-time predictions.

title: Anomaly Detection in Energy Consumption
description: Analyzed a 1.5M+ row energy consumption dataset and trained multiple Hidden Markov Models to detect anomalies. Identified an optimal 15-state model and applied data preprocessing techniques to improve accuracy and robustness.

title: Library Database Management
description: A mini-project to showcase our ability to design, create, manage, and implement a SQL database to capture the real-world requirements of a functioning library. It is currently being updated from a Python Qt GUI to React.js and Tailwind CSS front-end

title: Find-Your-Matcha
description: Find Your Matcha is a full-stack web app built during a 24-hour hackathon. Users can discover nearby matcha cafés, browse reviews, and add new spots through a Mapbox-powered interface. I implemented the Supabase backend for authentication, data storage, and review management.

title: Tetris Clone
description: A fully interactive Tetris clone implemented as a web application using React, Vite, and CSS. The game includes responsive controls, rotation mechanics, collision handling, line-clearing logic, and score tracking.

title: Undercooked
description: A 2D Java desktop application developed as a semester-long software engineering project. Implemented object management, collision detection, and enemy movement mechanics while working in an Agile team environment.
